page.title: 12FARMING IN NORTH SHROPSHIRE
page.content: We visited farms in North Shropshire. Mr Hardy at Kinsell farm has mostly grazing land the rest is for silage.We asked him if the wet June weather had affected him.He said that it has put him back for silage.Mr Hardy has some hay too.He has got 238 acres of land. There are twelve farms in our rectangular grid. Lane Farm is my Dad's. He is a dairy farmer but makes hay as well, he has no corn. In our area there are eleven farms of different sizes. The largest farm is Kinsell Farm of 238 acres,but most are about 100 acres.My father's Farm is 87 acres. The best time of the farming year is when we make hay. I like to help stack the bales. We can get a ton of hay on one trailer. At the farm I put them on top of the elevator. It certainly is a hot job to do, if you have shorts on the hay scratches legs.
